body:
Update 11/22/17

It was brought to our attention that, while in Discord we updated the chat rules, it was not updated on this post. As a staff team we apologize for this and would like to provide the current update.

CHANGES
The term "Nigga" is not allowed. If a player is using other words as a way around the Racism rule, this is punishable. Punishments for racism and homophobic slurs are still the length as stated below.

To help for clarity, I will also post the punishment lengths for the same offenses on Discord:
Racism / Homophobic SlursKick » 3 Days » 7 Days » 1 Month +
Sorry for any misunderstandings on our end for not updating this post.
If you have any questions please post a comment.

Thanks,
TylerdotMichael


Old Post 7/4/17


Spanish Translation | Swedish Translation | Russian Translation
Japanese Translation | Portuguese Translation |

Hey everyone.

We have updated two of our Chat Rules. Below are the new guidelines for punishments for these offenses. I have also included clarification on one of them as it has been asked by the community.

CHANGES
Racism*5 Days » 7 Days » Permanent
Homophobic Slurs3 Hours » 5 Days » 7 Days » Permanent

*The term "Nigga" is allowed with the following restrictions:
- Players are not allowed to overly use this word in a row. This would result in Excessive Language Offence.
- Using the word as a replacement for "bro" is acceptable. Using the word directed at another player is not. Example: "You nigga" "You are a nigga". This would result in Directed Language Offence.
- At no point is using "nigga" allowed to substitute other racist words.


Hope everyone in the States is having a great 4th of July! Plus, everyone else is have a great day too!

replies.body:
Hola a todos,

Hemos actualizado dos de nuestras Reglas en Chat. Abajo están las nuevas directrices para cada ofensa. Tambien e clarificado una de ellas por pedido de la comunidad.

CAMBIOS
Racismo*5 Días » 7 Días » Permanente
Insultos Homofobicos3 Horas » 5 Días » 7 Días » Permanente
*El termino "Nigga" esta permitido con las siguientes restricciones:
-Los jugadores no están permitidos para usar esta palabra demasiado. Esto puede resultar en Lenguaje Ofensivo en Exceso.
- Usar esta palabra como un reemplazo para la palabra "bro" es aceptado. Usar esta palabra para dirigirse a otra persona, no lo esta. Ejemplo: "Oye, nigga" "Tu eres un nigga". Esto resultara en Lenguaje Ofensivo como Ofensa Directa.
- En ninguna circunstancia se puede usar ''nigga'' para substituir otra palabra racista.


Espero que todos en los Estados Unidos estén teniendo un buen 4th de Julio! Ademas, les deseo un buen dia a todos!

replies.body:
みなさんこんにちわ。

 

私たちはチャトルールを更新しました。ここには新しい罰ガイドラインが添付されています。

 

変えたこと

 

 

人種差別主義          ５日 »７日 » 永久的

 

同性愛者のスラー           ３時間　»　５日　»　７日　»　永久的

 

 

“Nigga” とは言うえますけど、この制限を使いながら：

 

ー　何回も”Nigga”を言うはないでください。何度も言うと、Excessive Language Offenceになります。

 

ー　”Nigga”を “Bro”に置換することは使えます。別の人に”Nigga”と言ううと、Directed Language Offenceの罰になります。例えば、"You nigga" "You are a nigga"は使えません。

ー　人種差別的な言葉の置き換えはやめてください。

 

アメリカのみんなに楽しい4th of Julyを過ごせるよう希望しています。あとのみなさまに、好い１日を。

replies.body:
Swedish translation // Svensk översättning

Hej allihop.

Vi har uppdaterat två av våra Chatt Regler. Nedanför finns de nya hjälplinjerna för straff gällande dessa brott. Jag har också gjort ett klargörande för en av dem eftersom det har blivit tillfrågat av gemenskapen.

Ändringar

Racism*    5 Dagar » 7 Dagar » Permanent bannlysning

Homofobiska Slangord    3 Timmar » 5 Dagar » 7 Dagar » Permanent bannlysning

*Begreppet ”Nigga” är tillåtet under följande begränsningar:

-Spelare är inte tillåtna att använda ordet alltför ofta på en gång. Detta kommer att klassas som Överdrivande av kränkande ord.
-Att använda ordet istället för ”bro” är acceptabelt. Att använda ordet mot en annan spelare är inte tillåtet. Exempel: ”You nigga” eller ”You are a nigga”. Detta kommer att klassas som Riktande språkanfall.
-Det är aldrig tillåtet att använda ”nigga” som en ersättning för andra rasistiska ord.

Jag hoppas alla i USA har en trevlig 4e July! Och att alla andra också har en bra dag!

replies.body:
Olá a todos.

Nós atualizámos duas das nossas regras de chat. Em baixo estão as novas instruções para punições dessas ofensas. Também é clarificado uma delas por pedido da comunidade.

MUDANÇAS
Racismo*5 Dias » 7 Dias » Permanente
Insultos Homofobicos3 Horas » 5 Dias » 7 Dias » Permanente
*O termo "nigga" é permitido com as seguintes restrições:
-Os jogadores não estão permitidos em usar essa palavra demasiado. Isso pode resultar em Linguagem Ofensiva em Excesso.
-Usando a palavra como uma substituta de "bro" é aceitável. Usando essa palavra para se dirigir a outra pessoa, não esta. Exemplo: "You nigga""You are a nigga". Isso resulta em Linguagem Ofensiva como Ofensa Direta.
-Em nenhuma circunstância se pode usar a palavra "nigga" para substituir outra palavra racista.


Espero que todos dos EUA estejam a ter um bom 4 de Julho! E aos outros também!

Portuguese Translation//Tradução Portuguesa

replies.body:
A few questions about this EXTREMELY useful update...

Whose definition of racism and "Homophobia" are we using, the left or the right? Is it ok for me to be white or is that some unforgivable sin I had no choice in committing but clearly I am white because of my racism?

1 month + seems pretty open to interpretation. Is that 2 months or 2 years? Do you keep adding an extra week each time?

Again every rule, method and protocol made in this past year or so is either completely retarded or so fucking vague that you find that you've pegged yourself within a matter of weeks.

Honestly though for this issue we should just start fundraising for a freezer to keep the snowflakes from melting. If you can't handle the word nigga, thats ok, the internet isn't for all of us.

replies.body:
1. Your race does not affect the rule. No matter who you are, as it stands now, no one can use this language.
2. "1 month +" is the system we are using for Discord. Unless there is a specific reasoning, we are avoiding permanent bans on Discord currently. So this means that the next offense would be 2 months, then 3 months, etc.

It's totally cool to have your own opinion on this topic.We are addressing these topics based on how we as staff see fit. It is a learning process and we will make mistakes, as we are all human. We learn from them and move forward.

Let me know if you have any further questions.
replies.body_tagged:
1. Your race does not affect the rule. No matter who you are, as it stands now, no one can use this language.
2. "1 month +" is the system we are using for Discord. Unless there is a specific reasoning, we are avoiding permanent bans on Discord currently. So this means that the next offense would be 2 months, then 3 months, etc.

It's totally cool to have your own opinion on this topic.We are addressing these topics based on how we as staff see fit. It is a learning process and we will make mistakes, as we are all human. We learn from them and move forward.

Let me know if you have any further questions.

replies.body:
Responding to point 1:

I didn't ask the race thing as a serious question, it's a recent political debate that I thought would illustrate the long stretch between the left and the right when it comes to defining what they view as racism and homophobia. All I had to go on was the stance on saying nigga, which seems to indicate a leftist libtard approach but I asked anyway,  hoping for the best.

Point 2:

Coolio just wanted some clarification

Point 3:

Yes I'm well aware of how decision making works, I'd just assumed that after a recent string of very vague rules which cause issues down the track, the staff team would be taking steps to ensure they clearly define their rules. "No homophobia or racism" is a tad vague and as previously stated, what constitutes as racism or "Homophobia" is a lot different depending on political stance. For instance, leftists would be triggered by me calling something gay, whilst conservatives wouldn't bat an eyelid.

reply_to.body:
1. Your race does not affect the rule. No matter who you are, as it stands now, no one can use this language.
2. "1 month +" is the system we are using for Discord. Unless there is a specific reasoning, we are avoiding permanent bans on Discord currently. So this means that the next offense would be 2 months, then 3 months, etc.

It's totally cool to have your own opinion on this topic.We are addressing these topics based on how we as staff see fit. It is a learning process and we will make mistakes, as we are all human. We learn from them and move forward.

Let me know if you have any further questions.
reply_to.body_tagged:
1. Your race does not affect the rule. No matter who you are, as it stands now, no one can use this language.
2. "1 month +" is the system we are using for Discord. Unless there is a specific reasoning, we are avoiding permanent bans on Discord currently. So this means that the next offense would be 2 months, then 3 months, etc.

It's totally cool to have your own opinion on this topic.We are addressing these topics based on how we as staff see fit. It is a learning process and we will make mistakes, as we are all human. We learn from them and move forward.

Let me know if you have any further questions.

replies.body:
That is a very valid point. The issue lies in it's hard to put into exact words (without trying to list every scenario possible) what would be allowed and what isn't without players trying to use that to get around it. The overall theme of these rules is to not use specific words in chat.

The counter argument is that someone can still be racist and homophobic without saying those words - which is correct. Depending on how the topic / discussion is happening however, it - in theory - could fall under racism and homophobia but it could also fall under the rudeness, excessive language punishment as well as those cover directed language at a person or group of people.

You do bring up some good points and if you want to discuss this further please PM me on Discord! I'd love to discuss your views and opinions in some of the gaps and vagueness we have for these rules.

We want to be as clear as possible. Being part of the community, we want to hear suggestions on how we can improve!

reply_to.body:
Responding to point 1:

I didn't ask the race thing as a serious question, it's a recent political debate that I thought would illustrate the long stretch between the left and the right when it comes to defining what they view as racism and homophobia. All I had to go on was the stance on saying nigga, which seems to indicate a leftist libtard approach but I asked anyway,  hoping for the best.

Point 2:

Coolio just wanted some clarification

Point 3:

Yes I'm well aware of how decision making works, I'd just assumed that after a recent string of very vague rules which cause issues down the track, the staff team would be taking steps to ensure they clearly define their rules. "No homophobia or racism" is a tad vague and as previously stated, what constitutes as racism or "Homophobia" is a lot different depending on political stance. For instance, leftists would be triggered by me calling something gay, whilst conservatives wouldn't bat an eyelid.
